author: eric
post: Wouldn’t it interact with it tough? There are a lot of metals and components in blood that I would expect to interact, at least if there is some form of radiation involved..
title: It’s the Curmudgeon in Me

author: eric
post: Is there a way to replicate a dematerialization process like the one proposed by JJ in a lab? I am not being cynic and would really like to know..
title: It’s the Curmudgeon in Me

author: eric
post: When it comes to speculative quantum models of the consciousness, Orch OR appears to have the upper hand (with the recent discovery of QV in microtubules) and the core elements of that theory clash directly with biocentrism (not surprising, since Roger Penrose is notoriously against the string theory and biocentrism relies on it). Although, in the end both models end up proposing the same: that consciousness is a fundamental element in this universe..
title: Note to Russ Breault

author: eric
post: Seeing my past comment, I believe that it is more accurate to say that biocentrism borrows from string theory instead of saying that it relies on it..
title: Note to Russ Breault
